revised_title: Anatomy and Function of the Larynx in Singing
tldr: The author investigates the internal workings of the larynx during singing, observing the movements of the arytenoid cartilages, ligaments, and glottis. They describe the differences in vocal production between chest voice, falsetto, and head voice registers, and propose a theory for how sounds are formed through the compression and expansion of air in the glottis.
